memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2756

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to authorize the village of Port Jefferson, town of Brookhaven, county
of Suffolk to discontinue the use of certain city lands as parkland and
to alienate and convey such lands

PURPOSE:
To allow the village of Port Jefferson to discontinue the use of
certain parkland

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would allow the village of Port Jefferson to
discontinue .3467 acres of park land in exchange for
the dedication of 2.31 acres to parkland.

JUSTIFICATION:
The parkland to be alienated (.3467 acres) will be utilized to provide
access to the U.S.
Environmental Protection Agency for a funded project to build a ground
water treatment system to allow for the mitigation of contaminated
ground water and reduce or eliminate a ground water plume which is
feeding the waters of the Old Mill Pond, Creek and Port Jefferson
Harbor. After looking at a number of possible locations, this site
was deemed the most ideal to produce the most efficient and effective
results. The site is open land without any structures or other
improvements. The present use of this property and the surrounding
property has been restricted because of the existing environmental
issues. The installation of this system will serve to improve the
condition of the area.

The parkland to be dedicated (2.31 acres) is substantially larger in
area and will provide open space for the same purposes that the
alienated land was being used for.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2010:  S.7887

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the State.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
